intro: Cordia mukuensis, commonly known as the Muku tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often eaten by birds and small mammals. It is often found in savanna and woodland habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
